roleset.name: cause something to have an infection

role.descr: causer of infection, but not germ

roles.note: Reserve arg0 for only those cases where it's clearly a causal agent of infection; viruses don't count as intentional agents.

example.name: passive with germ
example.text: The Soviets' explanation is that the anthrax came from one lot of animal feed made from the bones of cattle that grazed on soil that-1 [*trace*-1]-2 was naturally infected *trace*-2 with anthrax spores.

example.name: germ as subject
example.text: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration said a computer virus has infected one of its networks and is spreading anti-nuclear messages related to its Galileo space probe, which is to be launched today.

example.name: ancient history
example.text: Charles Redmond, a NASA spokesman, said the agency discovered the virus on Monday on the collection of computer networks collectively called Internet and expected [100 university centers]-1 to be infected *trace*-1 by today.

example.name: with agent
example.text: John infects any room he enters with his foul stench.
